You've got to start recording the surface area out to 300 meters along the centerline of the crack using Satelite elevations positioning and use horizontal stakes GPS locatons for movement toward or away from the cracks center line.. Take measurements every 50 meters horizontally with GPS from the GPS identified edge of the crack. That way you can make a model. Also, lay PVC pipe in the bottom that has 1/8" holes drilled in it every 3 feet along the sides of the pipe. Then hook up a vacuum pump on one end to suck air through the pipe into a gas spectral meter to see if there are any changes in the areas air-gas mixture and humidity, also take readings from 100 meters upwind of the crack for a baseline reaffirmation air mixture reading every hour. Set up a seismic station at mid-point along the crack about 500 meters away from the crack saved to a digital graph. Take sample moisture readings every 50 meters along the inside of the crack at about 300mm from the floor of the crack or as close to the bottom of the crack in can be sampled and record elevations of the sample locations..
